text: was a Japanese naval officer and politician.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Saitō Makoto" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 809. ==Early life== Saitō was born in Iwate Prefecture. He was a member of the sixth class which graduated from the Japanese Naval Academy.Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN), "Graduates of Naval Academy class 6th," Saito Makoto. Retrieved 2012-9-3. ==Career== Saitō rose to the rank of Admiral in the Imperial Japanese Navy. He was Japanese Governor- General of Korea from 1919 to 1927. He returned to Korea as Governor-General from 1929 to 1931.WorldStatesmen.org, Republic of Korea, Governors-General; ewreiwcws 201-9-3. He was Prime minister from 1932 to 1934. ==Death== Saitō continued to be an important figure in politics as Lord Keeper of the Privy Seal from 26 December 1935. He was shot dead during February 26 Incident in 1936 at his home in Yotsuya, Tokyo. His predecessor was also killed along with several other top-rank politicians targeted by the rebels. ==Related pages== * Shōwa period ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1858 births Category:1936 deaths Category:Japanese admirals Category:Former dictators Category:Anti-communists Category:Japanese autobiographers Category:Assassinated Japanese politicians Category:Politicians from Iwate Prefecture Category:Prime ministers of Japan Category:Foreign ministers of Japan
title: Saitō Makoto
